class  LevelInfo

Detailed Description

Extends the item-grid to allow traversing a hierarchical menu. A menu is defined by an instance of the class ItemContainer, which may contain a variable number of items. As an ItemContainer is also an instance of the class Item, it is possible to recursively embedd item-containers inside other item-containers, which leads to a hierarchical item-tree.

Parameters:

item_cont Item-container, which specifies the items which should be part of the AbstractItemGrid.
adjust_win_title If set to TRUE, the title of the window where the item-menu is embedded will be adjusted automatically to the text of the currently shown item-container.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN ItemMenu::AdjustWindowTitle (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the title of the window where the item-menu is embedded will be adjusted automatically to the text of the currently shown item-container.

BOOLEAN ItemMenu::Back (   )  [virtual]
 

This method must be invoked to go back the menu-hierarchy. The method ItemMenu::GetLevel can be invoked to determine the current menu-level.

Reimplemented from AbstractItemGrid.

INT ItemMenu::GetLevel (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the current shown menu-level. 0 indicates the root-menu.

const ItemMenu::LevelInfo * ItemMenu::GetLevelInfo (  INT  level  ) 
 

Returns the level information for the level with the index level. Note that only a level information is provided for levels which are smaller than the current level. This is because all the information for the currently shown level is already provided by the methods from AbstractItemMenu. The current level can be retrieved by invoking ItemMenu::GetLevel.

void ItemMenu::OnLevelChange (  INT  old_level,
INT  new_level
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked, before the level of a menu will bee changed by the methods ItemMenu::Trigger or ItemMenu::Back. The method is also invoked when the window containing the item-menu is opened. By overwriting this method e. g. the number of columns of the menu can be changed dynamically dependant from the level.

Parameters:
old_level 
new_level

void ItemMenu::SetAdjustWindowTitle (  BOOLEAN  flag  )  [inline]
 

If flag is TRUE, the title of the window where the item-menu is embedded will be adjusted automatically to the text of the currently shown item-container.

BOOLEAN ItemMenu::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

Reimplemented from ItemGrid.

BOOLEAN ItemMenu::Trigger (  INT  index = -1  )  [virtual]
 

This method must be invoked to trigger an item (e. g. ItemMenu::Trigger may get invoked by pressing a softkey). Per default the selected item is triggered. If the item is an instance of the class Action, the action will be executed. If the item is an instance of the class AbstractItemContainer, the item-menu will replace the current content by the content of the item-container - this just means showing the content of the sub-menu.

Parameters:
index Index of the item which should get triggered. If the index is < 0, the selected item is triggered.
